snippet: A hospital on Long Island said patients may have received insulin from a syringe reservoir that could have been used more than once.
abstract: South Nassau Communities Hospital in Oceanside, LI, sends out over 4,000 letters to patients recommending that they be tested for hepatitis and HIV because of concerns about the proper use of an insulin syringe.
lead_paragraph: A hospital on Long Island said patients may have received insulin from a syringe reservoir that could have been used more than once.

headline.main: Long Island Hospital Warns of Possibly Contaminated Syringe
headline.print_headline: Hospital Warns of Possibly Contaminated Syringe
